Vaccine mandates could also the reason why a lot of people quitting their jobs ☺

Many times my managers refused to allow me to work from home when I had the flu, they wouldn't allow me in the office too, that was before the pandemic, so I had to use both sick leave, annual leave and unpaid leave when sick or had to stay home with a sick toddler. Man, not only did they cut my salary but they would humiliate me for the number of unpaid leave days. Now I've been working remotely for 20 months and I do not have the intention to go back to the office ever again. I'd rather work longer hours from home than being away from my child or having to see those people every day.

I work 75 hours a week.
If I work 40 hours I have to eat a cheese sandwich only

If I work 75 hours I can eat what I want to eat.

For me 
work = food
Food = survive
Quitting = die

I quit because after working 50 plus hours a week the only persons getting more money was corporate executives,  while they were telling us work longer...but no getting a head for me  only the report to the shareholders and the executives.  My advice is keep away from franchises
I have worked a bunch of different jobs . Because after a while you start to ask your self . This is insanity, to work 30 plus years to get a retirement plan  to pay for your funeral.
